comment.text: This translation key is used to display a message indicating that the user is using a free plan. It appears in a UI element related to payment or subscription settings and needs to be translated into the target language.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Lao translation "ທ່ານກຳລັງໃຊ້ແພັກເກດ {{planName}} ຟຣີ" directly translates to 'You are using package {{planName}} free'. While understandable, a more natural Lao phrasing for 'You are using free {{planName}} plan' would be something like 'ທ່ານກຳລັງໃຊ້ແຜນຟຣີ {{planName}}' or 'ທ່ານກຳລັງໃຊ້ແຜນ {{planName}} ຟຣີ'. The word 'package' (ແພັກເກດ) isn't necessarily the best fit here.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider revising to 'ທ່ານກຳລັງໃຊ້ແຜນຟຣີ {{planName}}' or 'ທ່ານກຳລັງໃຊ້ແຜນ {{planName}} ຟຣີ'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "Utilizaţi abonamentul gratuit {{planName}}" is a literal translation but might not be the most natural way to express the meaning in Romanian. "Utilizați" is the formal "you" form. A more common and natural phrasing might be "Folosiți abonamentul gratuit {{planName}}" or "Aveți abonamentul gratuit {{planName}}".

The word 'тариф' (tarif) translates to 'rate' or 'rate plan', which isn't as accurate as conveying the idea of a 'plan' as in the English original. While understandable, it slightly alters the intended meaning.

The Serbian translation 'Користите бесплатни {{planName}} план' literally translates to 'You are using free {{planName}} plan' which is accurate, but could be more natural. A more natural phrasing would emphasize the 'free' aspect more prominently.

The translation 'Bạn đang sử dụng gói dịch vụ {{planName}} miễn phí' is a literal translation and sounds a bit formal for a startup context. A more natural phrasing would be something along the lines of 'Bạn đang dùng gói {{planName}} miễn phí'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Bạn đang dùng gói {{planName}} miễn phí

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase "plan" is not accurately translated to "版本". While "版本" can mean 'version,' in this context, "计划" (jihua) would be a more accurate translation of "plan" as it refers to a service plan or offering.
